page.title: 14HEREFORD ABERGAVENNY TRAMWAY
page.content: Before the advent of the railway this was the main route for the transport of{coal}between Abergavenny and Hereford.{Horses}provided the motive power. The earthworks of this tramway are still visible for quite a distance in this area running adjacent to the northwest side of the main road from just north of Pontrilas to Howton Grove Farm, crossing the road at this point and continuing across the fields over the Worm Brook and crossing the railway line to the North East of Grove Park. From this point it becomes mostly indistinct to Hereford but obviously did pass close by Tram Inn,Allensmore.
